personalInfo.education: University of Michigan (2002, Sports Management and Communications)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditionally Exempt / 70th qualifier from Qualifying Tournament, Money List 61-100
tourBios.carHigh: 2011: Will be a rookie on Web.com Tour in 2012. Made the cut at the Mexico Open, his only prior start on the Web.com Tour. Has made one cut in six starts on the PGA TOUR. First teed it up as an amateur at the 1999 Buick Open...Has played on the Canadian Tour since 2004, winning the 2010 Mexican PGA...Played on the Sunshine Tour (2005-2006) and was a European Challenge Tour member in 2006.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was a two-time All State golfer at Forest Hills Central High School...Big 10 Freshman of the Year (1998-1999) and was named to the Big 10 All Conference team in 2002.
tourBios.personal: Co-founded iflightplanner.com...Biggest thrill outside golf is Saturdays in Ann Arbor for football games and piloting an airplane...Never travels without his phone or laptop...Always marks his ball with a pre-1972 quarter...Follows the Detroit professional teams, the Red Wings, Tigers and Lions...Enjoys watching college football and basketball...Twitter account is @mrandymatthews...Favorite gadget is his iPad and his Garmin GPS...Carries a peanut butter and jelly sandwich in his golf bag for that he eats during a round...Not many people know that he has his pilot's license.

tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won the 2001 Michigan Amateur and played in the 2001 U.S. Amateur, Captained the University of Michigan golf team and was named to the All Big-Ten Conference team in 2001-02, Voted Golf Association of Michigan Player of the Year in 2001, NCAA Big Ten Conference Freshman of the Year in 1998-99, joinMonday qualified for the Buick Open on the PGA TOUR in 1999 at the age of 19
tourBios.prYrSeason: Made four cuts in five starts in 2012, with a season-best T-33 finish at the Syncrude Boreal Open presented by AECON

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA T was 1st in 2010 at the Corona Mazatlan Mexican PGA Championship.
